mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn137:12.2.en: There are sights known by the eye, which are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasing, connected with the worldly pleasures of the flesh. Sadness arises when you regard it as a loss to lose such sights, or when you recollect sights you formerly lost that have passed, ceased, and perished.

mn137:12.8.pli: manoviññeyyānaṁ dhammānaṁ iṭṭhānaṁ kantānaṁ manāpānaṁ manoramānaṁ lokāmisapaṭisaṁyuttānaṁ appaṭilābhaṁ vā appaṭilābhato samanupassato pubbe vā appaṭiladdhapubbaṁ atītaṁ niruddhaṁ vipariṇataṁ samanussarato uppajjati domanassaṁ.
mn137:12.8.en: There are ideas known by the mind, which are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasing, connected with the worldly pleasures of the flesh. Sadness arises when you regard it as a loss to lose such ideas, or when you recollect ideas you formerly lost that have passed, ceased, and perished.

mn137:13.3.pli: ‘kudāssu nāmāhaṁ tadāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharissāmi yadariyā etarahi āyatanaṁ upasampajja viharantī’ti iti anuttaresu vimokkhesu pihaṁ upaṭṭhāpayato uppajjati pihapaccayā domanassaṁ.
mn137:13.3.en: ‘Oh, when will I enter and remain in the same dimension that the noble ones enter and remain in today?’ When you give rise to yearning for the supreme liberations like this, sadness arises because of the yearning.

mn137:13.10.pli: ‘kudāssu nāmāhaṁ tadāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharissāmi yadariyā etarahi āyatanaṁ upasampajja viharantī’ti iti anuttaresu vimokkhesu pihaṁ upaṭṭhāpayato uppajjati pihapaccayā domanassaṁ.
mn137:13.10.en: ‘Oh, when will I enter and remain in the same dimension that the noble ones enter and remain in today?’ When you give rise to yearning for the supreme liberations like this, sadness arises because of the yearning.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 137
The Analysis of the Six Sense Fields

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn102:17.4.pli: Pavivekāya pītiyā nirodhā uppajjati domanassaṁ, domanassassa nirodhā uppajjati pavivekā pīti.
mn102:17.4.en: When the rapture of seclusion ceases, sadness arises; and when sadness ceases, the rapture of seclusion arises.

mn102:18.2.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, pavivekāya pītiyā nirodhā uppajjati domanassaṁ, domanassassa nirodhā uppajjati pavivekā pīti.
mn102:18.2.en: In the same way, when the rapture of seclusion ceases, sadness arises; and when sadness ceases, the rapture of seclusion arises.

mn102:18.7.pli: Pavivekāya pītiyā nirodhā uppajjati domanassaṁ, domanassassa nirodhā uppajjati pavivekā pīti.
mn102:18.7.en: When the rapture of seclusion ceases, sadness arises; and when sadness ceases, the rapture of seclusion arises.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 102
The Five and Three

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn48.39:4.1.pli: Domanassavedaniyaṁ, bhikkhave, phassaṁ paṭicca uppajjati domanassindriyaṁ.
sn48.39:4.1.en: The faculty of sadness arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as sadness.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 48.39
4. The Pleasure Faculty
The Simile of the Fire Sticks

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn48.40:2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato uppajjati domanassindriyaṁ.
sn48.40:2.1.en: While a mendicant is meditating—diligent, keen, and resolute—the faculty of sadness arises.
